Show HN: ZTGI-AC – An AI that checks its internal stability before answering
raw_articles.summary:
Hi everyone,

This is a small experimental AI project I’ve been building called *ZTGI-AC*.

Most LLMs generate an answer immediately, but ZTGI-AC does something different: before responding, it runs an internal stability check.

It evaluates: • risk • jitter • dissonance • SAFE/WARN/BREAK modes • INT/EXT gating (self-monitoring loop)

Only after the internal signals stabilize does it generate a reply.

This project explores whether self-evaluation loops can reduce chaotic or un

raw_articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has built an experimental large language model that is far easier to understand than typical models. The day also saw several innovative indie projects including AI tarot readings, terminal-based programming assistants, and messaging-integrated AI tools.

raw_articles.title: Show HN: AI Tarot Reading – get instant 1/3-card or (past/now/future) readings
raw_articles.summary:
Description: I built AI Tarot Reading, a simple web tool that lets you pull a tarot card (or three cards representing past / now / future) and ask a question to get a reading. The idea is to make the tarot experience accessible, quick, and just a little mystical — whether you’re just curious, seeking insight, or playing around.

Key features:

Choose 1 card (for a focused answer) or 3 cards (past-, present-, future-style)

Enter your question and then the cards are drawn instantly

Readab

Show HN: SelenAI – Terminal AI pair-programmer with sandboxed Lua tools
raw_articles.summary:
I’ve been building a terminal-first AI pair-programmer that tries to make every tool call transparent and auditable. It’s a Rust app with a Ratatui UI split into three panes (chat, tool activity, input). The agent loop streams LLM output, queues write-capable Lua scripts for manual approval, and records every run as JSONL logs under .selenai/logs.

Key bits:

Single tool, real guardrails – the LLM only gets a sandboxed Lua VM with explicit helpers (rust.read_file, rust.list_dir, rust.http_r
